Roadmap

Exploring the Network

  • If you had \(n\) coupon of different colours, how many coupons should one buy, so that one collects all the \(n\) colors?
    Answer: \(n log n\)
  • This is popularly called the Coupon Collector Problem.
  • When we take a random walk on a random graph with \(n\) nodes, we can cover the entire graph in time \(n log n\).
    Reading Material

Sampling and Online Hiring

  • What is Sampling? It is not always More the merrier , we should neither over do it nor under do it.
  • Online hiring problem is all about waiting and sampling before jumping to a decision. Neither too less sampling nor too much of sampling is good for us.
  • Good examples where online hiring is in action: Partner selection, hiring, buyig/renting a house. Reading Material

Positive and Negative Relationships

Reading material: The whole of chapter 5 from Networks, Crowds and Markets

Random Walks, Markov Chains and Google

  • Understand Markov Chains with only two states : Hostel and Classroom Puzzle
  • Understand how the Power Iteration works. Reading material: Chapter 4 from Networks, Crowds and Markets

Strong and Weak Ties

  • Watch all videos of week 3 from this link. This is the 3rd chapter from the book

  • Read the advanced material and implement the Girvan Newman Algorithm.
